thread.title: No. 1 BC topples Army in opener
thread.title_full: No. 1 BC topples Army in opener | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: No. 1 BC topples Army in opener
text:
Miles Wood compiled a goal and two assists, while Thatcher Demko recorded 23 saves as top-ranked Boston College handled Army, 5-1, last night in men’s hockey action in West Point, N.Y. It was the season opener for both teams.
Wood’s unassisted goal midway through the first period got the Eagles on the board and they took the 1-0 edge into the first intermission.
Chris Calnan and Casey Fitzgerald added second-period tallies, while Chris Brown and Zach Sanford potted goals in the third.
Wood and Fitzgerald (goal, assist) registered their first career multi-point games. Alex Tuch also added two assists to the BC attack.
UMass 6, Colorado College 3 — Freshman Austin Plevy scored a hat trick in his debut with the Minutemen (1-0-0), who topped the Tigers in Colorado Springs, Colo.
UMass-Lowell 3, Rensselaer 0 — Kevin Boyle stopped 27 shots to lead the No. 14 River Hawks over the Engineers in the teams’ season opener.
Michael Louria, Evan Campbell and Adam Chapie scored for UML.
Providence 7, Miami 3 — Trevor Mingoia scored two goals as the defending champion Friars handled the No. 11 Redhawks in Oxford, Ohio.
Mark Jankowski added a goal and three assists for No. 7 PC.
Quinnipiac 5, Holy Cross 3 — Sam Anas netted a pair of goals as the No. 18 Bobcats dropped the Crusaders in their debut in Worcester.
Matt Vidal and Ryan Ferrill each compiled two points for Holy Cross.
Mercyhurst 3, Bentley 1 — Andrew Bentley scored, but the Falcons (0-1-0, 0-1-0 Atlantic Hockey) fell to the Lakers (1-0-0, 1-0-0) in Watertown.
Maine 3, Michigan St. 3 — Zach Osburn’s goal with 1:09 remaining lifted the Spartans to a tie with the Black Bears in Portland, Maine.
UConn 5, Alabama-Huntsville 2 — Max Letunov’s hat trick turned a 2-2 tie into a three-goal win as the Huskies grounded the Chargers in Huntsville, Ala.
Sacred Heart 1, Union 1 — Jacob Brightbill scored with 1:20 left in regulation to help the Pioneers tie the Dutchmen in the season opener in Schenectady, N.Y.
Women
Northeastern 5, Syracuse 4 — Shelby Herrington and Kendall Coyne each scored twice to help the No. 10 Huskies (2-0-1) nip the Orange (0-2-0) at Matthews Arena.
Taytum Clairmont netted the game-winning goal in the third period, while senior Jordan Krause and Lauren Kelly chipped in two assists apiece.
Sarah Foss picked up her first win of the season with 33 saves, including 11 in a frantic third period.
Penn State 5, Boston University 3 — Celine Whitlinger recorded 38 saves to lead the Nittany Lions (1-2-0) over the seventh-ranked Terriers (2-1-0) at Brown Arena.
Victoria Bach registered a goal and an assist for BU.
